docs.snippet: 5 P.M. PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION COVERAGE Election results will be carried by networks and cable channels throughout the evening, beginning with MSNBC at 5, and BBC America, CNN, CUNY, Fox Business and Fox News at 6. ABC, CBS, CNBC, Fox, NBC, TV One a...
docs.lead_paragraph: 5 P.M. PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION COVERAGE Election results will be carried by networks and cable channels throughout the evening, beginning with MSNBC at 5, and BBC America, CNN, CUNY, Fox Business and Fox News at 6. ABC, CBS, CNBC, Fox, NBC, TV One and Channels 41 and 47 will begin coverage at 7; BET, MyNetworkTV and New York 1 at 8; and Channels 13 and 49 at 9. CW will intersperse its regular programming with election updates. And DirecTV subscribers can watch a little of everything on the interactive Election Mix Channel (Channels 102 and 352), which will include feeds from each of the four broadcast networks, as well as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Comedy Central and BBC America, on one screen. 10 A.M. (ABC); 2 P.M. (55) RACHAEL RAY Joy Behar of ''The View'' discusses politics with her fellow host Elisabeth Hasselbeck.

docs.snippet: With two Republican state senators trailing in the polls, it appeared that the Democrats would control the Legislature for the first time since the New Deal....
docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 12:50 a.m., Nov. 5 | Bolstered by a surge of new voters, Democrats won a majority in the New York State Senate on Tuesday night, putting the party in control of both houses of the Legislature and the governor's office for the first time since the New Deal.
docs.abstract: With two Republican state senators trailing in the polls, it appeared that the Democrats would control the Legislature for the first time since the New Deal.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and DANNY HAKIM

docs.snippet: The question tonight for House and Senate races is how big of a sweep the Democrats will make, as Republicans try to stave off massive losses....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Few More to Go | 1:37 a.m. We're signing off now. You can follow the results through the rest of the morning at the Times's election result page. Looks like Senator Ted Stevens has an early lead over his Democratic challenger, Mark Begich, in Alaska; with 37 percent of the precincts reporting, Stevens was up 49 percent to 45. Minnesota and Oregon were neck and neck.
docs.abstract: The question tonight for House and Senate races is how big of a sweep the Democrats will make, as Republicans try to stave off massive losses.

headline.main: Live Blogging the House and Senate Races

docs.snippet: Also in the Morning Buzz: the battle over the State Senate, Eva S. Markowitz's chain of Harlem charter schools and more headlines from local papers....
docs.lead_paragraph: As millions of Americans -- perhaps reaching 130 million, a record -- head to the polls today, all eyes are on the presidential election, viewed as potentially one of the most significant elections in at least a generation. "In the heart of Blue America, along with judging the candidates' positions on taxes, the war and health care, there's almost a palpable yearning for a president who, for once, seems like us," Peter Applebome writes in his Our Towns column from Nyack, N.Y.
docs.abstract: Also in the Morning Buzz: the battle over the State Senate, Eva S. Markowitz's chain of Harlem charter schools and more headlines from local papers.

headline.main: Rein in Chief's Pay? It's Doable

docs.snippet: Senator John McCain just made his last campaign stop of 2008, one hour before the polls close in Indiana....
docs.lead_paragraph: ENROUTE FROM ALBUQUERQUE TO PHOENIX ON THE MCCAIN CAMPAIGN PLANE | 4:10 p.m. (Mountain Time) It's the last campaign flight and Mr. McCain has just come through the curtain separating the front cabin from the campaign reporters to say goodbye. His mood seems pleasant enough, but he's hard to read. Not so his wife, Cindy, or his friend Mr. Lieberman, who both stand with him and have tears in their eyes.
docs.abstract: Senator John McCain just made his last campaign stop of 2008, one hour before the polls close in Indiana.

headline.main: The Final Countdown: McCain on the Road
